node.title: Target makes Thanksgiving closings permanent.
node.alt: In another shift, Target has begun offering holiday shopping discounts earlier in October instead of waiting until Black Friday.
node.description: “What started as a temporary measure driven by the pandemic is now our new standard,” Brian Cornell, Target’s C.E.O., said.
node.content: ["Target stores will close their doors for Thanksgiving Day, the retailer announced Monday, and will continue the policy every year moving forward.", "The retail giant shut its stores on Thanksgiving Day last year, citing safety considerations during the pandemic. It has also started offering discounts for the holiday shopping season earlier in October instead of reserving those deals for Black Friday.", "\u201cWhat started as a temporary measure driven by the pandemic is now our new standard,\u201d Brian Cornell, Target\u2019s chief executive, said in a statement.", "Target announced earlier this month that most stores would reopen at 7 a.m. local time on Black Friday.", "Walmart has also said it would close its stores on Thanksgiving Day for a second year. Trader Joe\u2019s and Aldi will also be closed for Thanksgiving."]
